author: USA TODAY
title: Georgia hospital trolls Brady with crude sign
text:

Join the Nation's Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Georgia hospital trolls Brady with crude sign Charles Curtis , USA TODAY 2:20 p.m. ET Jan. 26, 2017 4 Shares 
Feb 3, 2016; San Francisco, CA, USA; General view of deflated Super Bowl 50 footballs at the NFL Experience at the Moscone Center. Mandatory Credit: Kirby Lee-USA TODAY Sports ORG XMIT: USATSI-264724 ORIG FILE ID: 20160203_jla_al2_089.jpg (Photo: Kirby Lee-USA TODAY Sports) 
Long after Deflategate ended, the scandal is still a punchline â€¦ at least for Atlanta Falcons fans. 
A veterinary hospital in Savannah, Georgia had a little fun at the expense of the New England Patriots with one very funny sign poking fun at Tom Brady, using the usual line of jokes everyone from tabloids to late-night comedians have employed about Deflategate: 
Owner Dr. Carla Case McCorvey told CBS12 she initially wanted employees to take it down, but she changed her mind: 
"I think everybody here is an Atlanta Falcons fan, well, not everybody. We've gotten some kind of tongue-in-cheek clients that have said, 'Hey, I'm a Patriots fan,' and we say, 'Nobody's perfect.'"
